sources.first_edition: April, 1773, Paris, Vénier (Op. 11), no. 1 of Sei Divertimenti per due violini alto e violoncello composti da Luigi Boccherini compositore e virtuoso di camera di S.A.R. Don Luigi Infante d'Ispagnia. opera XI, libro secondo di quartetti. Nuovamente stampata a spese di G.B. Venier. Prix 9. à Paris, chez Mr Vénier, Editeur de plusieurs ouvrages de musique rue St Thomas du Louvre vis à vis le Château d'Eau et aux adresses ordinaires. à Lyon Aux adresses de musique. A.P.D.R.
later_editions: (c. 1775), Venice, Marescalchi-Canobbio: no. 6 (for title, see No. 180)
(c. 1780), Venice, Zatta: no. 6 (for title, see No. 180)
(c. 1780), London, Preston: Op. 11 no. 6 (for title, see No. 180)
(c. 1785), Amsterdam, Hummel: Op. 8 no. 5 (for title, see No. 198)
(c. 1785), London, Welcker: Op. 11 no. 6 (for title, see No. 180)

(c. 1790?), Paris, Boyer (Op. 11), no. 1 of Sei divertimenti per due violini, alto e violoncello composti da Luigi Boccherini compositore e virtuoso di camera di S.A.R. Don Luigi Infante d'Ispagnia. opera XI. Libro quarto di quartetti. Mis au jour par Mr Boyer. Prix 9. à Paris, chez M. Boyer rue de Richelieu à la Clef d'or Passage du Caffé de Foy, à Lyon aux adresses de musique. A.P.D.R. Plate no. 518. With the stamp 'Vve Naderman'
sources.modern_edition: (c. 1930), Leipzig, Peters: Op. 8 no. 5 (separate parts; revised by R. Hofmann). This edition was re-published c. 1943 by the International Music Co., New York

partial_notes: Entry 178 appears to be a header section with detailed source information, but the actual quartet details (number 20, F Major key, Op. 15 no. 2 of 1772) are mentioned at the bottom, suggesting this is primarily bibliographic information for the string quartet series.
